image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Minnesota; born in New Brighton, Ramsey County, Minn., August 26, 1922; attended public schools and the University of Nebraska School of Engineering; interrupted his education during the Second World War to serve in the United States Army, with service in the European Theater of Operations; employed by the Minnesota Mining & Manufacturing Company; international representative of OCAW-AFL-CIO 1947-1958; member of the Minnesota house of representatives, 1950-1958; elected as a Democrat to the Eighty-sixth and to the eight succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1959-January 3, 1977); was not a candidate for reelection to the Ninety-fifth Congress in 1976; established a consulting firm; died on May 29, 2005, in Scottsdale, Ariz.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Ralph Nader Congress Project. Citizens Look at Congress: Joseph E. Karth, Democratic Representative from Minnesota. Washington, D. C.: Grossman Publishers, 1972.

researchRecord.name: 1968, 3 commercials on 1 film reel.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Joseph Edward Karth's campaign for the 1968 U.S. congressional election in District 4, Minnesota, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication

researchRecord.name: 1959-1977, 44 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Joseph Edward Karth include congressional office files, supplemented by speeches, a few campaign files, photographs, and miscellany. The subjects covered the strongest include labor issues, economic development, the space program, the Vietnam War, and natural resources. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.

researchRecord.name: In the Steven J. Gadler Papers, 1956-1985, 4 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Joseph E. Karth. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Louis Edward Lerman Papers, ca. 1917-1978, 11 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Joseph E. Karth. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the "Save the Saint Croix" Records, 1962-1968, 3 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include Joseph E. Karth. An inventory for the papers is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the State Capitol Employees Union Local 597 Records, 1960-1966, 0.3 cubic foot.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Joseph E. Karth.
